TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed LoggerVerbosity extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the available verbosity levels of a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The descriptions of verbosity levels are only guidelines to how a typical logger (including the default [!INCLUDE[vstecmsbuild](~/add/includes/vstecmsbuild-md.md)] console logger) logs build events. Loggers are free to interpret verbosity levels in any way they want.
## Examples The following example shows how to write a basic logger that responds to build events.
[!code-cs[msbuild_BasicLogger#1](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/msbuild_BasicLogger/msbuild_BasicLogger.cs#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Build.Framework.LoggerVerbosity Detailed = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Detailed verbosity, which displays errors, warnings, messages with values of or , all status events, and a build summary.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Build.Framework.LoggerVerbosity Diagnostic = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Diagnostic verbosity, which displays all errors, warnings, messages, status events, and a build summary.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Build.Framework.LoggerVerbosity Minimal = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Minimal verbosity, which displays errors, warnings, messages with values of , and a build summary.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Build.Framework.LoggerVerbosity Normal = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Normal verbosity, which displays errors, warnings, messages with values of , some status events, and a build summary.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Build.Framework.LoggerVerbosity Quiet = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Quiet verbosity, which displays a build summary.
